alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 11:23AM EDT until May 04 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warnings are extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Maine... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll and Oxford Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Belknap and Merrimack Counties. Lamprey River Near Newmarket affecting Rockingham and Strafford Counties. For the Saco River...including Conway...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lamprey River...including Newmarket...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...From this evening to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect flooding of low-bottom fields and private roads in Conway and North Conway. Minor flooding in Transvale Acres, Moat Brook Bridge, and the lower part of E. Road flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 9.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
